en: Murphy catches you in the corridor, eyes red-rimmed. Got a minute?
Murphy pulls you into an empty storage room and closes the door.
That joke I made in the cafeteria... about my cousin being in the [color=DARK_VIOLET]Root Reserve[/color] batch...
Murphy's voice cracks. I don't think it was a joke anymore.
You said it wasn't funny. You were right. [color=STEEL_BLUE]Nothing about this is funny.[/color]
I saw you leave. Smart. I wish I could stop eating that stuff, but they [color=YELLOW]watch[/color]. They always watch.
I found something in my cousin's belongings. His rejection form. Standard stuff, but...
Murphy pulls out a crumpled form. Look at the processing code. "[color=CRIMSON]RR-UTIL-7[/color]."
I looked it up in the archives. RR stands for [pulse freq=2][color=DARK_VIOLET]Root Reserve[/color][/pulse]. UTIL means... [color=CRIMSON]utilization[/color].
[wave amp=20 freq=3]Murphy's hands start shaking.[/wave] My cousin... Tommy... he was just twenty-three.
He came here for a [color=CHARTREUSE]better life[/color]. Failed one inspection. One. [color=STEEL_BLUE]Just bad timing.[/color]
Murphy slides down the wall, face in his hands. And I... I [tornado radius=3 freq=2][color=CRIMSON]ATE[/color][/tornado] that stuff. Every day.
Murphy looks up at you, tears streaming. [pulse freq=2][color=CRIMSON]What if I ate HIM?[/color][/pulse]
Murphy... I'm so sorry. I'm with you. We'll find the truth together.
Murphy, this is dangerous. We should stay out of it.
Maybe it's a coincidence. Let's not jump to conclusions.
You kneel beside Murphy, putting a hand on his shoulder.
Murphy grabs your arm like a lifeline. [color=CHARTREUSE]Thank you.[/color] I thought I was going crazy.
[color=STEEL_BLUE]His voice steadies slightly.[/color] For Tommy. We do this for Tommy. And everyone else they've taken.
There's others who suspect too. Sasha's been gathering people. I think she trusts you.
Murphy wipes his eyes, trying to compose himself. Yeah. Yeah, you're probably right. Forget I said anything.
But if you change your mind... I'll be here. [color=STEEL_BLUE]Alone with my questions. And my nightmares.[/color]
Coincidence. Murphy laughs bitterly through his tears. Sure. And Tommy just [color=CRIMSON]vanished[/color] into thin air.
Keep telling yourself that. See how long it helps you sleep. [color=STEEL_BLUE]It doesn't help me.[/color]
Sasha appears at your booth as the last shift ends. You look like you've seen a ghost.
Let me guess - Murphy told you about his cousin?
Sasha nods approvingly. Good. We need people who ask questions.
Sasha studies your face carefully. You're scared. That's smart. But fear won't save anyone.
I've been watching you since your first day. The way you [color=YELLOW]hesitated[/color] when Russet talked about "processing."
You asked what happens to rejected potatoes. That took guts. [color=CHARTREUSE]Most just salute and stamp.[/color]
Sasha leans closer. There's a pattern. Every potato we reject? Gone within 48 hours. No deportation records. No transfers.
But [color=DARK_VIOLET]Root Reserve[/color] production? [tornado radius=3 freq=2][color=CRIMSON]It goes up.[/color][/tornado] Every. Single. Time.
I believe you. How can I help?
I need to see proof before I risk everything.
Sasha's eyes light up. I knew I picked right. Tomorrow night, after shift. I'll show you what I've found.
Until then
Fair enough. Proof is coming. Just... keep your eyes open during tomorrow's shift.
Watch where the [color=CRIMSON]rejected potatoes[/color] go. Follow the trucks if you can.
You pull out the photo the desperate potato gave you. Her wife. [color=STEEL_BLUE]Where is she now?[/color]
If what Sasha and Murphy are saying is true... she's already been...
You can't finish the thought. But you [color=CHARTREUSE]won't forget her face[/color].
Tomorrow, everything changes. Either you find answers, or you bury the questions forever.
One thing is certain: there's [color=YELLOW]no going back to blissful ignorance[/color].
